segment.source: You can use Internet Explorer 11 and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager to change whether page rendering should use Enterprise Mode or the default Internet Explorer browser configuration.
segment.target: You can use Internet Explorer 11 and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager to change whether page rendering should use Enterprise Mode or the default Internet Explorer browser configuration.

segment.source: You can also add, remove, or delete associated comments.
segment.target: You can also add, remove, or delete associated comments.

segment.source: Edit the Enterprise Mode site list using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Edit the Enterprise Mode site list using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Edit the Enterprise Mode site list using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager
segment.target: Edit the Enterprise Mode site list using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: You can use Internet Explorer 11 and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager to change whether page rendering should use Enterprise Mode or the default Internet Explorer browser configuration.
segment.target: You can use Internet Explorer 11 and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager to change whether page rendering should use Enterprise Mode or the default Internet Explorer browser configuration.

segment.source: You can also add, remove, or delete associated comments.
segment.target: You can also add, remove, or delete associated comments.

segment.source: If you need to edit a lot of websites, you probably don’t want to do it one at a time.
segment.target: If you need to edit a lot of websites, you probably don’t want to do it one at a time.

segment.source: Instead, you can edit your saved XML or TXT file and add the sites back again.
segment.target: Instead, you can edit your saved XML or TXT file and add the sites back again.

segment.source: For information about how to do this, depending on your operating system and schema version, see Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) or Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1).
segment.target: For information about how to do this, depending on your operating system and schema version, see Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) or Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1).

segment.source: To change how your page renders
segment.target: To change how your page renders

segment.source: In the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager, double-click the site you want to change.
segment.target: In the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager, double-click the site you want to change.

segment.source: Change the comment or the compatibility mode option.
segment.target: Change the comment or the compatibility mode option.

segment.source: Click Save to validate your changes and to add the updated information to your site list.
segment.target: Click Save to validate your changes and to add the updated information to your site list.

segment.source: If your change passes validation, it’s added to the global site list.
segment.target: If your change passes validation, it’s added to the global site list.

segment.source: If the update doesn’t pass validation, you’ll get an error message explaining the problem.
segment.target: If the update doesn’t pass validation, you’ll get an error message explaining the problem.

segment.source: You’ll then be able to either cancel the update or ignore the validation problem and add it to your list anyway.
segment.target: You’ll then be able to either cancel the update or ignore the validation problem and add it to your list anyway.

segment.source: For more information about fixing validation issues, see Fix validation problems using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager.
segment.target: For more information about fixing validation issues, see Fix validation problems using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager.

segment.source: On the File menu, click Save to XML, and save the updated file.
segment.target: On the File menu, click Save to XML, and save the updated file.

segment.source: You can save the file locally or to a network share.
segment.target: You can save the file locally or to a network share.

segment.source: However, you must make sure you deploy it to the location specified in your registry key.
segment.target: However, you must make sure you deploy it to the location specified in your registry key.

segment.source: For more information about the registry key, see Turn on Enterprise Mode and use a site list.
segment.target: For more information about the registry key, see Turn on Enterprise Mode and use a site list.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Download the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2)

segment.target: Download the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1)
